name: Le Grimaldi

reviews.text: Great hotel. Booked it on reading other guests on this website so for a 'first-timer' I highly recommend it. Staff very friendly and helpful, nice breakfast, very clean bedrooms and bathrooms. Even if we had a late rise any morning when we came back in the evening the bathroom was re-cleaned with new towels every day. Nice spacious room - classic bedroom. 10 minutes walk to all major facilities and the beach. We ended up staying longer in the hotel than we had even intended. Free web access for residents. We had a street room and small balcony which was a huge addition - no major noise complaints. 3 small negatives - extra minor tax cost added per couple on checking out which we were not aware of, we had to wait up to 10 minutes on 2 nights for the night porter to arrive and let us in and the last - dont consider having any kind of drink from their little hotel bar unless money is no problem!
reviews.title: Made our holiday

reviews.text: Great place though and would go back in the morning.
reviews.title: Like a Breath of Fresh Air
Great small hotel
reviews.text: (my comments on Nice though not as positive - see other section on this website)

reviews.title: Very Good Hotel
reviews.text: What a darling little hotel! We enjoyed our stay and really appreciated the friendly welcome we recieved from the staff. What a difference that makes! They offered a free bottle of champagne and had cold bottled water waiting in our rooms. The lobby areas are bright and cheery. The staff was so helpful with restaurant recommendations, driving directions, suggested sights to tour, etc. We had two connecting rooms, one Standard and one Classic. The Classic room with a double bed was slightly larger and had a larger bath. It had a big bay-type window that opened onto a very small balcony. Both rooms were decorated with fresh, charming prints. The bathrooms were wonderful: clean, bright, lots of counter and cabinet space, plenty of huge towels, good hair dryer, L'Occitane toiletries. The hotel is in a good location for walking or driving; their parking lot is close by and the hotel is just a few blocks off the water, near shopping, Old Nice, ten minutes drive to the airport, etc. They have two free internet access computers in a room off the lobby. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

reviews.title: Excellent service, perfect location
reviews.text: We were not sure where to stay in Nice but used trip advisor as a guide. We loved Le Grimaldi. The room was good size, the bathroom huge. We were on the first floor, front, and if we go again I would try to get a little higher up as it was a little noisy in the morning.

My friend and I stayed at Le Grimaldi for two nights in late May (we stayed at Comfort Hotel Roosevelt the first night, because there was no availability at the Grimaldi; the Roosevelt lived up to its TripAdvisor rating in being cheap, clean with good bathroom, and a good choice for a more budget-conscious hotel). The Grimaldi cost a little more but was excellent value for money. We had a double room with french doors for 150euros. The color scheme was charming, there was so much storage in the bathroom it could be in your home, everything was clean and fresh. We were just very comfortable in this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone going to Nice. You're walking distance to the train station (we wanted a sandy beach rather than Nice's rocky one, so we went to Juan-les-pins on the hotel staff's recommendation), Vielle Nice, and the shopping district. I just loved this hotel and hope to go back for a winter break so I can actually make it to the Matisse and Chagall museums!
reviews.title: More Praise for Le Grimaldi

reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at Le Grimaldi in Nice and it was great! The room was large with two beautiful french doors that opened up to the outside. The bathroom was wonderful with a shower and tub and it was spotlessly clean. The best part of staying there is the wonderful staff who were so kind and friendly to us and went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. Especially helpful was a beautiful young lady named Sophie. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Le Grimaldi is a wonderful hotel
Nice was nicer than expectations
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at Le Grimaldi for 3 nights. Unfortunately, when we booked the flights we didn't realise that the Cannes International Film Festival was on for that period so accommodation was limited and more expensive. We chose Le Grimaldi although 150 euro per night is more than we would typically spend, so we would probably not return for this reason. The rooms were comfortable though not luxurious. Helpful bonuses were the free internet in a room near the breakfast room and the complimentary water in the mini bar for our arrival. The staff were friendly and provided a map and advice upon our arrival. Breakfast was 10 euro extra per person, although it was probably worth it to get us going for the day (cereal, fruit, yoghurt, egg, toast, pastries, juices, tea, coffee etc). The hotel was well located between the train station, the old town, and the prominade. Having heard some poor reviews of Nice we were pleasantly surprised. I can recommend Cafe de Turin for seafood and a short train trip to Monaco.

The rooms was very comfortable and well appointed. Great view of the church across the street. I couldn't get the AC to work though. Wonderful bathroom. The desk staff was very courteous and helpful at all hours of the day. The breakfast is also quite good. Nicely located near everything, but not so close as to be bothered by the heavy tourist spots not too far away. The free internet use was also very much appreciated and sorely missed once we left. Would certainly stay there again. Not a bargain, but you do feel you are getting a good value when you compare it to some the very high end hotels on the beach.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay.
A nice hotel in Nice!
reviews.text: We chose this hotel through reading the recommendations on this site and were not disappointed. Great location and friendly, helpful staff ensured a pleasant stay. Rooms generally spacious and well equipped. Good choice of continental breakfast on buffet but little choice for cooked breakfast. Recommended.

reviews.title: Grim Grimaldi ?
reviews.text: We have just returned from a stay at the grimaldi hotel and found it to be a good base to get around nice. The room was very comfortable and clean .We would have liked tea and coffe making facilities in the room which for a price of £110 per night is not an excessive demand and also breakfast included which would have been a nice touch as coffee and a croissant is not to expensive.

reviews.title: The Best Stay
reviews.text: After struggling to walk from the Nice train station to the hotel with our lugagge, we were surprised and delighted when we were welcomed by the lady at the front desk. She took her time to talk to us, and tell us about the area and places to eat and see. We were also happy to find out that we got upgraded to a suite.
Our suite was beautiful. The bathroom was exceptionally spotless, and the facilities in the room were great.
reviews.title: What more can you say about this gem of a hotel?
Quiet, Friendly and Clean
reviews.text: The staff helped us organise our train tickets online, and a tour around Nice and Monaco.
The breakfast was so satisfying, with pastries and croissants, cheeses, cereals, yogurts, and fruit.
reviews.title: A bit disappointed
An excellent hotel
reviews.text: Just returned after four days in the Grimaldi. Very well situated, well away from all the tram construction noise, and convenient for Old Nice, the best shops and the Promenade des Anglais Charming staff, spotless bedrooms and bathrooms. One minor point, the small breakfast room sometimes means a wait at peak times. Good value and excellent in every way.

At the last minute we wanted a break for a few days and chose Nice. We always look at reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed with our choice. I completely agree with the previous review, we too had a superior room (no.27) overlooking the church.
reviews.title: Just what we wanted

reviews.text: We decided to have breakfast each day, which instead of being 15 euros was 10 if you had it everyday and is well worth it. There is a large selection - breads, cheese, ham, eggs boiled/scrambled, fruits, tea, coffee.
reviews.title: Worth a repeat visit

reviews.text: We would definately recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Nice for either a long or short stay.
reviews.title: LIved up to its reviews
Le Grimaldi-great value in a small hotel
reviews.text: Having enjoyed an earlier stay in this hotel we returned with friends this year. Like us they were impressed with the amenities of the superior rooms. The bathroom is generously sized with two wash basins and an adjoining large shower cubicle. As a bonus the loo is separate.
We felt that the Hotel was good value for money, clean and tidy. The staff were very helpful although breakfast time could be chaotic over the weekend as people checked out etc
reviews.title: Geat Hotel shame about the view from our bedroom...

reviews.text: The standard(classic) room was spacious and well appointed for the price but the outlook from our room was onto a shared courtyard area which had not been paticularly well tended.
reviews.title: Pleasant well situated solid 4 star hotel
Nicely appointed hotel with a staff that tries (to please and the nerves)
reviews.text: The breakfasts were in line with the price charged
The Hotel is ideally situated for the city centre, promenade de anglais and the railway station.
reviews.title: pleasant stay !
Perfect.........
reviews.text: We would certainly stay there again when visiting Nice.

We arrived at the hotel around 3 am and were greated by the night receptionist who took care of the luggage unrequested and check-in was trouble free. The hotel has two entrances, one on each side of the building, that dont provide access to the other side of the building. This was problematic on occassion, especially the first night. The hotel provided beach access for 17 euros per person. You can save money by buying a couple of grass mats for 6 euros and sunning at the free beach next store. We chose to use the pay beach for they had chairs, umbrellas and food service.
reviews.title: OK Hotel. Good for the price. Relatively close to the beach

reviews.text: The room was ok. The bathroom was clean and spacious, with great lemon smelling soaps and shampoo (from Provence) provided. They has ice available and provided a free bottle of Evian. We bought beverages and stored them in the room's minibar.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff and a great hotel

reviews.text: We agree that the biggest failing of this hotel was access in the evening. For security, the hotel had a sliding glass door which was locked for access from the outside but opened automatically on a sensor from the inside. We were left standing in the street outside because the reception desk was unattended and we had to wait for someone to come after calling on the intercom.
reviews.title: Great staff, near meetings if you are friend of Bill W

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at Le Grimaldi in early July 2005. This hotel is centrally located (5-10 minute walk from the beach, 10 minute walk from the old town, and 2 minute walk from restaurants and shopping area). The hotel itself is on a quiet side streets, so you do not have to worry about too much noise from the outside. (The only downside is that the walls are a bit thin, so we could hear our neighbours at times.)
reviews.title: Not the most luxurious but.........

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very well kept. We stayed in the Classic room on the 4th floor facing Rue Grimaldi. It was clean, nicely decorated, and good size for european hotel standards.
reviews.title: Good hotel but not Excellent

reviews.text: We stayed at Le Grimaldi from 19th - 24th August and we would thoroughly recommend this hotel. The staff were so helpful, they gave us all the local knowledge/maps we needed and even booked our airport transfers for us. Our room, which was on the top floor (No: 67) overlooked the church and was extremely quiet. The bathroom was the best we had ever had. The air conditioning came in very useful. All in all a lovely hotel and lovely staff.
reviews.title: Le Grimaldi is great !

reviews.text: We're just back from a week at the Grimaldi, staying in a superior room facing the church - it was so quiet (once the windows were closed) that you'd never guess it was in the middle of a busy city. We were only 5 mins walk from the beach, 10 mins from the train station - the Grimaldi is in an ideal location.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: Service was good, breakfast was good, facilities were as advertised - though be careful if you use the PC in the Salon D'Internet - it's riddled with spyware & viruses!
reviews.title: A delightful boutique hotel

reviews.text: DEFINITELY, if you go there, try the restaurants next door - there's the little Italian-style cafe place (with the grumpy lady and the big dog) on Rue Grimaldi, but on Rue Maccarani (where the church is) there is a wonderful French restaurant which does some might consider a fairly expensive set menu (I think it was €40pp), where the food was worth twice as much. There's another little French place on Rue Victor Hugo, just in front of the Carlton Hotel, which is also worth a visit.
reviews.title: wonderful small hotel
Great Location, Average Cleanliness
reviews.text: DO NOT go to the Maison de Marie on Rue Massena - it looks nice, set back down a little alley from the main street, but the food was poor, relatively expensive and the service was shockingly bad. I ordered steak medium-rare, they brought me it (90 mins after ordering!) well done, so I sent it back. Next thing the guy brings me out a blue steak ... and proceeded to make sarcastic comments in French to me...

I stayed in the Grimaldi for 3 nights over Halloween. I kind of agree with the last review. I was expecting great things from the hotel, after reading such superb reviews on Tripadvisor. I enjoyed my stay and most of the staff were very helpful. The room was certainly big enough and the view of the church was much better than that of the courtyard. The comments about the bathroom products are true (So my girlfriend tells me). Location wise, it is pretty close to the Riveria and is about 20 mins dander to the Old Town. The only gripe was on my last night...I just got engaged and after a night out we headed back to the hotel. I thought I would have a nightcap to round off the special occasion. I dont think the desk guy was too happy having to open the bar (It wasnt late it was only 12:30) I got a whiskey, they only had 1 choice of whiskey...Do not drink their whiskey, it is horrible, I had never heard of it before and after tasting it I know why. The main gripe though was the price, 12 euros for a measure of flavoured meths. I would stay away from the hotel bar if you stay here, unless you are minted. Overall I enjoyed the stay, I wouldnt get over excited by the other reviews though, I would have enjoyed the hotel more if my expectations were not so high.
reviews.title: Everything is good but not great

reviews.text: Just a quick note on Nice, in the off season it is pretty quiet. It is a good place to go for relaxing but not for partying. Finally, try not to eat in the pedestrian part near the shops, the food isnt great and the prices inflated for us tourists.
reviews.title: It's OK

reviews.text: I stayed here whilst at a conference and if I am honest I was a little disappointed with the hotel after reading such good reviews. The room was a good size and great if you like yellow. It wasn't spotlessly clean but nothing too bad and the bathroom was big and well equipped. Didn't get much chance to interact with the staff but they were very pleasant. Would I stay here again - probably not, but maybe I was spoilt by the Best Western West End on a previous night, which was considerably better.
reviews.title: Great Value!!
Nice Small Independent Hotel in Nice - October 2005
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in early November,weather was great and hotel matched it.The location is perfect close to sea,shops,15mins station yet in a quiet part of town.Staff will arrange transfer from airport and are very helpful.The rooms are bright and clean with nice bathrooms.Do use the train to get around as it is very cheap , clean and reliable.Great restaurant next door make sure you book.

After originally booking with known chains, Le Meridian, Shereton Four Points, Best Western, etc., we identified Le Grimaldi through tripadvisor reviews. We checked out their web site and after some exchange of emails we booked with them. We booked the middle level double room for 150 Euros per night. Although they do not have designated non-smoking rooms, they promised the rooms would be aired. We were not dissappointed - there was no smell of smoke.
reviews.title: Outstanding value, excellent hotel

description: A few steps from the famous Promenade des Anglais and the beach of Nice in the heart of downtown, Le Grimaldi is ideally located for your stay in Nice. Discover our offers lines.
